brief_description: This is a two part prospective, observational, multi-center cohort study of SOT recipients. The first part is a cross sectional comparison of perceived barriers to adherence to post-transplant immunosuppressant regimens in parents of children (0-11 years) versus adolescents (12-21 years). The second is a longitudinal study to evaluate whether perceived barriers to adherence increase with time during the first year following transplantation.
brief_title: Perceived Barriers to Patient Adherence after Pediatric Solid Organ Transplantation (CTOTC-05)
description: This is a two part prospective, observational, multi-center cohort study of SOT recipients. The first part is a cross sectional comparison of perceived barriers to adherence to post-transplant immunosuppressant regimens in parents of children (0-11 years) versus adolescents (12-21 years). The second is a longitudinal study to evaluate whether perceived barriers to adherence increase with time during the first year following transplantation.
endpoints: 1. Perceived barriers to adherence in adolescents (12-21 years of age) and parent/legal guardian of pediatric (0-11 years of age) at any time post-transplant using BMQ, PMBS and AMBS questionnaires. 2. Change in perceived barriers to adherence from baseline (1-3 months) to follow-up (9-12 months) using BMQ, PMBS and AMBS questionnaires.
hypothesis: The hypotheses to be tested in this study are: 1. Adolescents (age 12-21) after solid organ transplantation (SOT) will perceive greater barriers to medical adherence to post-transplant treatment regimens than younger SOT recipients (11 years or younger). 2. Perceived barriers to adherence to post-transplant SOT treatment regimens will increase as time from transplant increases.
objectives: To evaluate perceived barriers to adherence through the Parent Medication Barriers Scale (PMBS), Adolescent Medication Barriers Scales (AMBS) and Brief Medication Questionnaire (BMQ).
official_title: Perceived Barriers to Patient Adherence After Pediatric Solid Organ Transplantation (CTOTC-05)
